xtc.lang.cpp

Class ForkMergeParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser

  • public class ForkMergeParser
extends Object
    This class expands macros and processes header files
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.263 $

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax
      A syntax object and it's sequence number, buffered in a linked-list so that multiple subparsers can read tokens from the same stream.
      static class  ForkMergeParser.StackFrame
      A frame of the parsing state stack.
      static class  ForkMergeParser.Subparser
      A subparser.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CHOICE_NODE_NAME
      The name of the AST conditional node.
      static boolean FLATTEN_MERGED_CHOICE_NODES
      A different way to merge choice nodes is to flatten them instead of creating a hierarchy.

        public void setKillSwitch(int cutoff)
        Set a kill-switch. The parser will stop after the given number of seconds.
        Parameters:

        public Object parse()
        Parse the syntax stream.
        Returns:
        The AST.

      • handleError

        public boolean handleError(ForkMergeParser.Subparser subparser)
        Handle a subparser in an error state.
        Returns:
        true to keep the subparser, false to throw it away.

      • parseNaively

        public Object parseNaively()
        Parse the syntax stream.
        Returns:
        The AST.

      • follow

        public Map<Integer,xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> follow(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax a,
                                                         xtc.lang.cpp.PresenceConditionManager.PresenceCondition presenceCondition)
        Find the FOLLOW set of a given token. When the given token is an ordinary token, the set is just the token alone. But when the token is a conditional, this method returns the set of ordinary tokens reachable from this conditional in all configurations.
        Parameters:
        a - The token to find the follow set of.
        presenceCondition - The presence condition of a. This presence condition will be freed, so pass a reference.
        Returns:
        The follow set of the given token.

      • hasCachedSet

        public boolean hasCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t)
        Test whether the conditional token already has a follow-set computed.
        Parameters:
        t - The conditional.
        Returns:
        true if the follow-set is cached.

      • getCachedSet

        public Collection<xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> getCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t)
        Get the cached follow-set for a conditional token.
        Parameters:
        t - The conditional.
        Returns:
        The follow-set.

      • setCachedSet

        public void setCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t,
                Collection<xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> follow)
        Cache the conditional token's follow-set.
        Parameters:
        t - The conditional.

      • isParseable

        public static boolean isParseable(Syntax syntax)
        Determine whether a token is parseable. The only parseable tokens are Language tokens and EOF.
        Parameters:
        syntax - The syntax to test for parseability.
        Returns:
        true if the syntax is a Language or EOF token.
